result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence G. Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence G. Allen

records.addlTxt:
9:07 AM Defendant Lawrence G. Allen appeared by video.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Lawrence G. Allen.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant agrees zoom audio is sufficient for today's hearing. State speaks to plea agreement. Defense agreed to plea agreement. Mr. Allen pleads guilty to count one. Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty. State/Defense speak to sentencing. Defendant does not make a statement. 

Court orders: 30 days jail IMPOSED AND STAYED, 3 days credit, huber granted 12 months probation with conditions of AODA assessment, mental health assessment and any other programming deemed appropriate by agent, $443.00 payable within 60 days to the Clerk of Court's Office.

3:09 PM Defendant Lawrence G. Allen appeared by video.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Lawrence G. Allen.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court is allowing zoom appearance for a special circumstance on today's date.  State speaks to status on the case.  Defense speaks on the case.  Requesting plea and sentencing date.  Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lawrence G. Allen
Current: 1740 S 2nd St, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 02-08-2022)
Prior: P.O. Box 494 711 Cloud Street, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

3:52 PM Defendant Lawrence G. Allen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Lawrence G. Allen.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he was at a funeral for last hearing.  He states he did call and attempted to appear by video.  There was an attempt at a VA without success.  Attorney Jolin could not take this case due to conflict on this matter.  Represents defendant on 22CM29 however.  Court quashes warrant.  Court reinstates prior cash bond with same condition of absolute sobriety noted.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on August 16, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Lawrence G. Allen appeared by video, Attorney Courtney Christine Nagel for Lawrence G. Allen appeared in court, Attorney Karl Peter Hayes for State of Wisconsin appeared in court.  Attorney Nagel recieved complaint and waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. Court accepts waiver and sets pre -trial for June 7th at 9:30 am
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence G. Allen appeared by video, Attorney Nagel for Lawrence G. Allen appeared in court, Attorney Karl Peter Hayes for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Court modifies bond to $100.00 cash. Conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety. Court quashes warrant. Court sets adjourned initial appearance appearance to March 16th at 1:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lawrence G. Allen not in court, Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin appeared in court for Lawrence G. Allen, Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court issues a $250.00 on the non appearance.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause that criminal activity has been made. Court sets $1000.00 signature bond. Conditions,   Maintain absolute sobriety. Court sets initial appearance to February 28th at 10:00 am.
